page.title: 01The Village.
page.content: Pontneathvaughan is the anglicized name of the village most commonly used and is a corruption of the old Welsh name Pontneddvechan which is still used on maps.It is a small village with only a limited amount of employment and most people have to commute to work.The chief industries are tourism and farming. There are three pubs,two clubs,and a small post office and village store combined.There are two chapels,one church and a village hall which is in the process of construction.The only other public amenity is the primary school which is described in greater detail on page 2. The nearest town,where most of the villagers do their shopping is Glynneath which is about 2 miles away.The large town of Neath is about 8 miles away and Swansea 15 miles.
